description:
Best. Donuts. Ever. Dare you to find a fluffier donut in the city. It's cool...I'll wait. 

The folks behind the counter are gems too!
author: Jen S.

description:
There is no better donut place in all of San Francisco than Happy Donuts. Here are the facts: it's open 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. It's got all the classic, doughy, no-fuss pastries you crave. It's right on the J line and near the 48. It's cash-only because it's cheap, and it would be ridiculous for you to buy enough to make using a card worth it-- but you can, if you want. You can. At 3 in the morning. And you'll love it.

I think this may be one of the last remaining true 24/7 donut joints in SF, in fact. Donut World in the Sunset now closes for at least 2 hours at about 4 in the morning, I think, but Happy Donut is here for you, and it couldn't be in a nicer part of town, still in a central part of Noe Valley just away from the very busiest part. That's the way I like it.
author: AJ P.

description:
Avg donuts here. Could dona better job of glazing them. Got 2 donuts for $3.20

Quick in and out with fantastic parking when it is late
author: Atif J.

description:
She hands me the complete wrong donut and then argues with me regarding Which one I ordered. It's
Not that tough to order and get a glazed donut.
Regardless it was extremely oily and soggy, will never go back there
author: Jad A.

description: The donuts were fluffy and light and had just the right amount of sweetness, an excellent snack after work or for tourists roaming the streets.
author: Joaquín B.

description:
One of the first places I hit whenever I'm back at Noe Valley is Happy donuts.  

I'm naturally a happy person in the morning.  So what better place to bring my coffee and enjoy a nice donut.  Quite good pricing compared to what I've been used to in all the froo-froo donut spots that I've become accustomed to.  $1.05, for the basics, $2 or under for the others.  A dozen makes the count level about $.85 per, so even though I came to get one donut..the value chaser in me wanted a dozen.  

I typically get a glazed yeast, but this time I wanted an old-fashioned glazed.   Was very happy with the selection.
author: Monty W.

description:
BRUH this Happy Donut is open 24 hours, 7 days a week?! Do you know how much work it goes into keeping something open for 24 hours? A LOT, so this place is WIIILLD. A1 in my book. Their donuts and breakfast sandwiches are where its at, so if you're ever feeling like anything at any time of the day (literally any time of the day) come through, cus they will not disappoint.

Stumbled upon this gem at 6AM on a Saturday morning after a wild night out. THANK U YELP. Ordered some breakfast sandwiches, because the heavenly combination of bread, cheese, eggs, and meat always gets me pumped for the day. And the girl literally pulls out a pan and scrambles the eggs, heated up the sausage and bacon, and added the cheese to a toasted croissant. TALK ABOUT SERVICE, MA DAMN.

So, needless to say, my friends and I have agreed that this will now be the spot we hit up the morning after a wild night. Because they are super friendly and patient, they have all kinds of fresh donuts, they have coffee, and most importantly, they have both bagel and croissant breakfast sandwiches !!! And this place is pretty inexpensive too, so you cannot get better than this!
author: Eva C.

description: Luv this place. I've through here at all sorts of hours. Whether it's 6am, 9am, 10pm, weekdays, or weekends, the donuts are always fresh. Good price w/ good donuts, run by nice people!
author: Kirsten V.

description: This is my regular spot every morning. I come here to get a good value. Coffee is delicious and the donuts are yummy. More than all of that, however, are the friendly customers and the great staff.
author: John G.

description:
good glaze donuts holes, always my go to when I'm craving something sweet after hopping off the J line. because it's right there and I can avoid it. Ha. 

but very decent raspberry filled glazed donut and sub par marble bar. not so good.

but the donut glazes holes make me happy when I get that deadly craving.


UPDATE: hot damn, i had a FRESHLY just made off the rack cheese danish... oh my word. it was amazing. butterly, flaky and the filling in the middle was cheesy and wonderful.

UPDATE: their late night bagel and cream cheeses always hit the spot - SO GOOD!!
author: Shruti D.

description: I ordered a bacon, cheese and egg croissant sandwich, cinnamon roll and coffee on a Monday afternoon. Was greeted by friendly staff and the sandwich was made fresh. The cinnamon roll was delicious- soft, buttery and melted in my mouth. Cash only and open 24 hours.
author: Jillian D.

description: Came here on Tuesday after work. It was the only donut shop close to my workplace that was open by the time my shift was over. Donuts are light and fluffy. Shop is cash only, but they have an atm inside for your convenience. The atm charges you $3 to withdraw cash so if you wanna save $3, make sure to have cash on your person already before stopping by.
author: Jasmine V.

description: The maple donut from this place tasted like sweetened white bread with maple frosting. It's a classic donut shop that gives off a pre-hipster San Francisco vibe mixed with neighborhood donut shop vibes. The donuts are on par with the quality of Dunkin Donuts, which is not a good thing. Overall, a subpar donut shop in a great city.
author: Nick C.

description: Only place in noe valley that doesn't give you microwaved eggs in your breakfast sandwich so that is a huge win. Also charges you less than the other spots ($4.95). Only complaint is the bagels but really no where in SF has good bagels so I'm okay with it for now.
author: Shabnam E.

description:
Well if you today find a donut shop that has open 24 hours in Sam Francisco. Then your lucky. When you find this donut shop you been even blessed with more luck!  So I found it at 2am in the morning. 

It's not only that they make donuts that are tasting good they have the full me u the whole day. So bagels, donuts, sandwiches, danish, croissants and drinks. 

Highlight for me was the bacon egg cheese croissant that I had is prepared fresh so the egg will be actually made to order and you taste it!
Yummy. Skip the coffee (they are selling such a lot of coffee and refill often still ha this caramel coffee taste when it's to long on a warming plate) good that they also serve espressos and lattes so you get a really fresh coffee of you order that. 

The shop has four generous tables so it is okay to have a cupa here and enjoy watching people. 

So why one star he place is very clean what you would not expect for a hole in a wall donut shop but they taking good care. The whole time I was having my croissant the Guys are baking and frying and working. 

So why "only" four stars? Well service is "limited" what means they lack a bit of friendliness and are a bit rough. But hey again it is 2am in the morning (well now it's almost 3am, what's better then a sandwich and a coffee and watching people take a chance do it here) 

Maybe they earn that star someday when I am showing up at 4pm :-).

** important information even in the age of people paying with their phone and square this a place fighting for your coins. So just cash. But they have an ATM available if necessary
author: Martin W.

description: This is my favorite donut place for so many reasons! I always get the old-fashioned chocolate donut because it's so light, fluffy, and not super sweet like Krispy Kreme. Other pros include the cheap prices, 24/7 service, and the store location which is in the safe and family-friendly neighborhood of Noe Valley. The only con is that it's cash only, however, there are plenty of banks and ATMs nearby making it not a problem. Definitely recommend this place!
author: Jessica B.

description:
!!!!

I stop often to bring doughnuts to my class; I have to stop because its getting costly ha ha-

but its normal prices- just that I am buying many for students- in any case-

ITS worth it- I grew up here; I grew up near Happy Doughnuts- they have changed hands many times through the years- it is not a completely Independent place; and will look a bit like a chain- but it IS an actual bit of a time warp back to OLD SAN FRANCISCO and real SF values-

not completely overtaken by rampant commercialism of Googlers and Google buses ( not paying taxes for SF City street upkeep!)

Here, @ 5 in the morning you can hear local SF politics being spoken/ dialogue! over a cup of - pretty darn good real drip coffee- without one of those silly chain made "gourmet" and "specialized" coffee drinks-

DEFINITELY try Apple Fritters and glazed Buttermilk bars are great-

Honestly, they are not the most individually made, hand made artisan doughnuts-

they are just a real local, what was a small chain ( there used to be one on Haight street); doughnut shops-

MUNI drivers crank the J car to a dead stop to come in here for 3:00 a.m doughnuts- so do cops-

and I met a couple of old rockers who have been driving from Pacifica to get their doughnuts from Happy Doughnuts at 4 in the morning since the 1970's!

So come on down, open 24 Hours! The owners and workers are also REALLY nice! and nice customers!!

Thanks on Thanksgiving Day for a San Francisco staple! ...and for the hard work you do- thanks for supplying us with delicious, affordable doughnuts and coffee!!!!!! :)
author: Gigi M.

description: One of my favorite donut shops in Noe Valley.  I work not too far from here so try to stop in when I'm craving something sweet.  Always happy with my selection.  The jelly donuts are to die for, as well as the chocolate old fashion.  The prices are very good and the donuts are pretty big.  Their name says it all.  :)
author: Allison J.

description: Glazed donut. A classic. The best. Twice the substance of a Krispy Kreme - and just feels more homemade. 5 ***** XO
author: P J.

description: Very good donuts and pastries, and great service.  Everything you would want in a neighborhood establishment.
author: Kim F.

description:
Something about local places like this that I like. They're not hipster. No frills. Standard. Good. Simple. Dependable. 

They need to start accepting credit cards though. Cash only gets annoying when everyone else is accepting 9348239423 different forms of payment.
author: Yad L.

description: Donuts aren't usually my thing.  If I'm going to indulge in sugar and gluten, croissant's are more appealing.  The last time I tried one of their donuts here it was not fresh.  However I should give them 5 stars for being open 24/7.
author: Sheila F.

description: Who can give a low rating to a donut shop that's open 24hrs?!!! NOT I! I didn't ever go late/super early, but I went a few times. I was always glad they were there, right on my bus route. One morning I ordered a ham, eggs and cheese croissant and I swear there were like 4 eggs on that thang! And the apple fritters were mmm mmm good. Coffee was alright and they have a fridge case with cold drinks too. It's a really quaint place with tables along side a wall of windows for prime people watching. Seems like the kind of neighborhood place where  everybody knows your name, and they're always glad you came . Lol
author: Denise D.

description: Donuts are probably best I've had in SF. Make it in-house, and everytime I go there in the morning, the donuts almost melt in my mouth. Atmosphere is extremely serene, can look out the window and enjoy the sights while you drink coffee or read a newspaper.
author: Raymond F.

description: We love this place. I always go there with my kids and we enjoy the donuts on Friday. My favorite donut are their glazed.
author: Sean B.

description: good selection of donuts, breakfast sandwhiches, and a fridge full of cold drinks.  they're open 24/7, even during holidays.  what more could you ask for?  cash only.  yes, they sometimes run out of specific donuts but understandable due to being open all the time.
author: Dean L.

description: I LOVE this place! Donuts, sandwiches, bagels, everything is so tasty. Don't be fooled by the unassuming exterior. Food is great, coffee is great, very nice lady who runs the shop, and fantastic prices. I visit here several times a week and it's the best shop in the area for what I need :)
author: Tessa O.

description:
10 stars if I could. This place is the most gangsta spot in da city. We got donuts, brekko Sandos (no microwaved eggs here my playas), coffee, and various beverages including the realist of real: sunny D (original California formula, none of that Florida junk). It always tastes fire and the staff knows what's good (although most of them don't speak much English except the sexy one with the gauges. Ps: if you see this review, hit a playa up girl). 

Ok here's the best part- it's cheaper than McDonalds and it's open 24/7... In stroller valley none the less, which is lit AF fam.

Lastly, it's cash only. But all my playas carry mad stacks so we always good with the HD (happy donuts)

Been lit fam go get yaself some fire donuts and tell them Teddi P tha kid says what's good.
author: Teddi P.

description: the best doughnuts in SF. I live dangerously close and it doesn't help they are open 24/7! Nice family run business.
author: Selah K.

description: I came here late at night. Seemed like a clean place to eat. I ordered a sandwich for me and my friend. We both got sick before finishing them. Not a very clean place to be eating. Beware.
author: Dylan N.

description:
This hole in the wall donut shop will bring you back to your childhood. 

5 stars for:
- being 24 hours
- having donuts!
- having CROISSANT sandwiches (BREAKFAST!!)
- never being too busy/crowded

This is our go to spot when it's late night and nothing is open anymore.. and when daly city is too far out for us. I will gladly stop by the ATM to give my business to this establishment, and I never carry cash on me. 

Our favorite is the turkey bacon croissant, mine without onion. OR the sausage breakfast sandwich. I'm getting hungry now.
author: Jenna R.

description:
Happy Donuts hits me with a mixture of nostalgia whenever I walk by.  It hints of a bygone era of much simpler, happier times.  It actually reminds me of hanging out with a favorite, bachelor uncle of mine when I was a kid.  He would frequent a donut shop like this and flirt with the uniformed waitresses while enjoying a good cup of coffee.  I would tag along occasionally and he would treat me to a glazed chocolate donut and/or maybe a maple glazed one too.
The smell from the street of warm cinnamon, sugar and fried donuts makes me happy and transports me to a good place.
author: Thomas D.

description: I stumbled on this spot out doing Uber and I was so happy to see a non fast food spot open at a late hour. The salami sandwich was good and I got some good ol donut holes. Everything was no more then $7 and he threw in some chips. I'll be back
author: elise j.

description:
Their doughnuts are great, but the real draw for me are the breakfast sandwiches. 5 dollars for the best damn breakfast sandwich you can find. Crispy awesome bacon, and they actually USE A FRYING PAN to cook the eggs! There isn't a microwave in sight. What more could you ask for?

And the people behind the counter have always been friendly
author: Nelson S.

description: I bought food here and i sat down talking to boyfriend and I had my foot on the chair across me. The guy who took our order from Asian descent told me loudly to get my foot down and I did but he was rude ran out it. I didn't even see a sign that said "no feet on chairs" or anything like that. Time passed by and I had put my foot on the wooden stand-bar right below the seat and he came up to me and snatched the chair and said "excuse me no". I honesty didn't even see the big deal because it's 12:00am and no one was there. I don't think I'll be coming back when he's here.
author: Alexis B.

description: Happy Donuts is my neighborhood 24hr donut shop. They are always super friendly, their donuts are always delicious, and they are ridiculously cheap. If you are ever hungry after 10pm and in the vicinity of Noe Valley, you need to come to Happy Donuts. Trust me, you won't be disappointed.
author: Dylan H.

description:
Reviewing this place is really hard for me. I should start by saying the donuts are fairly decent; at like a dollar each you can't really go wrong. They do cheap sandwiches (with free chips!) which are also pretty ok.

The problem for me is that the night-shift staff have always been crabby, unhelpful, and unfriendly toward me. Overall, for me this is a steady go-to for late night drinks and sandwiches, but I get in and get out ASAP and don't really enjoy the experience.
author: George B.

description: I get coffee from this restaurant almost 3-4 times a week. The people who work in the morning are lovely. The person who works the night shift (i.e. Right now at 9 pm on Sunday) is probably the rudest person I have ever met. That is the sole reason I am giving the place a one star. He was slow, impatient and inconsiderate every one of the multiple times I went in. If anyone is thinking of going to happy donuts late at night I would urge them to reconsider and go somewhere else to save themselves the attitude and frustration of dealing with a surly cashier.
author: Sakshi C.

description: My bf and I had Saru sushi nearby and decided that it wasn't enough and we wanted to try Happy Donuts. While on yelp, we saw plenty of review about how big the croissant sandwiches were. It started to drizzle so I waited in the car while he went inside. He got me a maple bar, and a croissant sandwich with ham, egg, and cheese. The size was like WOAH, when we opened it. The maple donut was great, loved the taste, the dough was fresh and soft. But if you've ever tried Bob's donut out in polk st. I feel like they dip their bars a couple more times so you can really taste the maple on top. But this donut here, is soft, fresh, and pretty light in that you won't be dying of thirst after you eat it. The croissants are pretty pricey, anywhere from 6-7 dollars. I mean, it's more like a costco croissant with some egg and cheese and ham, they don't give much ham, maybe like 2 slices but they fold it to make it appear more. The egg though, was great, plenty in there. Great place, to go for late nights, get a sandwich and some dessert.
author: Amy Y.

description: They are many to choose from and the price are right. I love sweet donuts , but can't  eat  too much.
author: John B.

description:
I try to never leave a negative review, but the guy working last night, who I assume is the owners son, was very rude for absolutely no reason. 

Pretty sure he must hate his life/parents or something cause he was not happy to be there and made it apparent. I genuinely couldn't understand how he could be such a dick to paying customers.

I asked my buddy and he said he is always that way. 

The donut was fine. I wouldn't have left a review one way or the other if this guy wasn't such a prick.
author: A. G.

description:
Happy Donuts is open 24 hours to satisfy late night cravings when my will power is low. 
Unfortunately, I never seem to succumb to the donut except very late.....well after anything with maple has sold out. This is sad for me, because I love maple bars and maple old fashioned donuts.

Don't get the buttermilk bar;  it's a poor substitute and tastes like coconut and fakeness. It's just bad.  The cinnamon roll is okay (but still not a maple old fashioned donut.) Probably the apple fritter is the best thing to get when they are out of the good stuff.  It's sweet, crispy and tastes great. No weird fake flavoring. 

On Friday there was a cop there getting some coffee. Kinda cliche, but all good. I'm only mentioning that in case you're a big stoner so you can plan accordingly. There were also some young men ( they didnt look stoned) trying to choose from the limited selection and I feel they chose badly ( cake donuts with multi-colored candy sprinkle thingies ...blech) I was gonna tell them to get the apple fritter but they were in line ahead of me, and there was only one left....and I'm not that nice.

Three stars because they never have maple anything when I'm there, and I hold a grudge.
author: El B.

description:
My ultimate comfort food at 2am or 6am.

Although the staff is not necessarily personable or nice, I could still overlook this fact because of the undeniably delicious and fluffy custard filled chocolate donut and the donut holes!

Everything is pretty reasonably priced, and taste pretty decent. I've got to say that their custard filled donuts are one of the best I had in my life time. I do not like donuts that much, but this place made me in love with them and turned me into a fatty.

My usuals are custard filled donuts and a cup of coffee. Best way to start the morning, or midnight.

OPEN 24 hours, YAS.
author: Solongo B.

description: Don't know how the donuts are because nobody served us. We stood by the donut counter and then what we thought was the line and the cashier just overlooked us. Like we were invisible.
author: Elena L.

description: My family of 3 needed to eat breakfast and not the "best meal of your life" kind. Just a normal, affordable breakfast. We were so happy to find this place! Croissant, english muffin and bagel sandwiches were awesome, Tried cake and regular donuts, both of them melt in your mouth, but the cake donuts more so. The staff was super friendly! Breakfast for 3 cost the same as one meal at a fancy breakfast place. I will be happily giving Happy Donuts my cash for the coming days!
author: Astrid V.

description: The donuts are ok but the service sucked the guy working at night was super rude bad attitude Jelly Dounts way better and friendly service I don't know why I even went to Happy donuts never again
author: Star A.

description: Damm good choices and fresh standard classic old fashioned donuts - done right. I had an Apple fritter that was fresh and not greasy or excessively doughy. Wife loves the maple old fashioned. Cruellers light, airy. Cash only. Friendly.
author: Pete M.

description:
The fact that they are open 24/7 makes me HAPPY.

The fact that they only take cash does NOT make me HAPPY.  

The Cinnamon Swirl Donut makes The Better Half HAPPY.

The surprisingly delicious Chocolate Glazed Cake Donut makes me HAPPY.  

The pink box filled with a dozen assorted donuts makes my coworkers very HAPPY.

The mediocre coffee does NOT make me HAPPY.

The sweet ladies who work here make me HAPPY.

Overall, I am a HAPPY and regular customer of HAPPY DONUTS.
author: Amy C.

description: Came by twice this week, so I can appreciate that Happy makes an above-average glazed donut and the donut holes were a hit with my daughter.  Prices are cheap and there's plenty of seating if you stop by on a weekday morning.  Easy on/off from the J Church means this would be trouble if I worked or lived over here (thank goodness, I'm a visitor to SF now since I have moved!).
author: Justin B.

description: Straightforward and no-frills donuts that are affordable, really good and bring me back to my childhood. I stick with the classic glazed and maple bars!
author: Doug V.

description: The young guy behind the counter is rude to customers for no reason. Gave hard time to customers before me and when I gave him a $50 bill for my order, he refused to take it. His reasoning... "I never seen this bill before!".... A $50 bill printed in 1999 you never seen before? Really? In a cash only place?
author: Diyor K.

description:
Went in,  got a coffee and sat there by the window for about 20 min playing on my phone and drinking my coffee. The place must have had 3 other people in it. 

Before I leave, I use the bathroom.  On my way out a very grumpy old lady that I can only assume was the owner told me the restrooms weren't public and asked me if I was going to buy something. 

Hello? You didn't seen me sitting there for 20min drinking your coffee in your empty donut shop? What kind of owner are you?
author: Syl D.

description: My brother and I grew up in this neighborhood and used to sell Sunday newspapers in front of this store!!!!  I came here tonight, 20ish years later and I'm so happy they're still good.  Open 24hours, cash only.  Bigger better menu than before.  I'm thankful this is one of the few places here that haven't gone trendy and decided to sell overpriced organic yuppy, hipster food that only the techies can afford
author: Karin E.

description:
I'm very disappointed on how the people who work here treat their costumers. I would have left one star, but the coffee was good. The bread and coffee did its fix, but honestly the service here is horrible. I came here with a group of people and one child looking for a place to spend some time together and grab a cup of coffee. They continuously kept telling us to be quiet when obviously there weren't any costumers, but us. 

Hopefully, the people who work here begin to treat their costumers better.
author: Adelene M.

description: Great donuts, great coffee super nice staff. Not expensive. Perfect 10 mins stop for resting.
author: Raz L.

description:
I've been coming here for my whole life, and the brief period they were closed this winter was a dark time for the whole neighborhood. City, even. 

Happy Donuts are great any time of day, but honestly this place peaks around 2:30am, when everything is fresh and everyone is a little bit tipsy. (Except for the taxi drivers and police men?) Ideal location for post-party snacking or accidentally running into old friends.

Not going to choose a favorite donut because that is not a decision anyone should have to make. They sell these suckers by the box for a reason...
author: Madeleine M.

description:
Ordered a cup of coffee and a chocolate old-fashioned before work. They were both excellent and I will definitely be coming back here. There were 8-10 different varieties of coffee and I went with Vanilla-nut which I thought was superb. The service was also very friendly and greeted me with a smile and conversation.

I would give this a 5 star review except they only had 4 4-person tables, all of which were occupied by single men in their senior years. It's fine for patrons to relax at the tables, but I think this place could accommodate more people with two top tables.
author: Jacob A.

description: These doughnuts make me go nuts! They are so delicious! I just brought a dozen of these fluffy glazed bundles of joy to my work and they are going there after work! I am one happy gal and so are they! It is located right near the J stop, so waiting for the full train is not so bad anymore.
author: Jessica L.

description: Happy Donuts has great classic  glazed raised donuts.  You can't go wrong with any donut here. Everything is so fresh.
author: Richard D.

description: Just grabbed a sugar donut from this place as I waited for the muni. I was excited for it because the place seemed to be a freshly baked donut place. The person behind the counter was not super friendly, but I shook it off. Went to bite into my donut and found a bug dead on it. Appetite lost in 2 secs. When I walked in to the place I had noticed quite a few flies, but figured the donuts were protected in the casing. I was wrong.
author: Gaby E.

description: I was catching a plane back home to NYC at 7AM, which meant I had to leave my house around 4:30 to get there in time.  I had a rental car to return, etc.  It was the only place near me that was open at 4:30!  Miracle of miracles when you're awake at 4:30AM and you need some serious coffee, which I got!  Great place!  I will definitely be hitting up Happy Donuts again if I'm ever back in SF.
author: Sarah S.

description:
Not the best doughnuts in the city but it satisfies the cravings. Personally I find Krispy Kreme and the like unappealing and too sweet. I don't get what others see in them and much rather prefer the kind of doughnuts produced in these small mom/pops. 

I'll agree with another reviewer, their doughnuts still taste good the following day. That's always a big plus!
author: Esther A.

description: Don't be fooled by the exterior, these are the best donuts in town!  Not fancy just delicious- and cheap!  The staff is hard-working and friendly. Conveniently located on 24th and Church Street right by the J Church muni line.  It's not a Friday without a donut and coffee from Happy Donuts
author: Ed F.

description: The owner could not be more unpleasant if he tried. Worst energy. He should move to a different planet.
author: Michael S.

description:
I got off work late last week and had a craving for something sweet. A coworker of mine recommended Happy Donuts since they are open 24 hours. 

When I arrived I was immediately disappointed in the selection of donuts that were available. There were only apple fritters, plain glazed and cake donuts with white frosting. It was 1:00am on a Tuesday which typically isn't a busy day or time for any business so, for a 24 hour donut shop I definitely expected to have many more options. Like REALLY?! No donut holes?! Unbelievable!

I decided to order two of each that were available. Six donuts = $7.00 and change--not bad, especially since apple fritters are usually more than $2.00 each.

The man who was working was less than pleasant. No "hello," "what can I get for you," "thank you," or even a hint of a smile. Clearly customer service isn't a priority at this place. Some may overlook the lack of customer service, but for me, I like to feel appreciated when I'm spending my hard earned money (YES, even if it's for a $1.25 donut)

The donuts were pretty good, especially for what they cost but the poor selection and lack of customer service were quite off putting.

I suppose it's a good place if you have a late night craving for anything sweet, but frankly, if it can wait there are better options in SF.
author: Andreea M.

description: If I could give this place 0 stars o would!! I ordered a bacon and cream cheese bagel and when I opened it it was egg bacon and cheese!! We went back to the counter and said we said that we ordered a cheese and bacon bagel and he told us that wasn't what we ordered but there was three other people who was with me and clarified what I said we order!! This was not the first instance that iv occurred here! I'm never coming back!!
author: Linda M.

description: Okay donuts: Buttermilk glazed was the star rest were very meh. I definitely like the donuts better at All star donuts in the inner richmond.
author: David G.

description: Donuts are good, but the breakfast sandwiches are the shiznit. Huge and delicious.
author: Jay N.

description:
It's midterm season so I need caffeine and snacks at 2 am in the morning, when most food places are closed; definitely excited to see this place was open and a few blocks away from my bf's house.

The cashier didn't seem too friendly but I'm not going to hold that against him, he seemed tired as it was so late already.

Got Apple fritter, donut holes, jelly filled donuts, coffee, and then also a can of coke and a bottle of orange juice to fuel an allnighter. The coffee was decent, tasted like it was freshly brewed so at least I didn't get the leftover coffee from earlier in the day.

I think the place was more of 3.5 stars but I'll round up since it helped me get through the night.
author: Rose L.

description: When we first lived in SF I would walk to this place once every couple of weeks for the donut fix. When we recently returned i was disappointed with my donut options, so I drove a dozen blocks, or so, to Happy Donut. Having read several of the lower reviews, all I can say is, " I no want friendly, I want donut", and I get a good donut here.
author: Chris M.

description:
Happy Donuts is all over San Francisco, but I only favor this one- they're open 24 hrs and fresh every hour of the day! 

I'll see you soon again, Happy!
author: Patricia T.

description:
It's 1130pm, you find yourself near Noe Valley suddenly desiring a hot and sweet treat. Castro is too far away (joke), and everything's far past closed - you begin to despair...

HAPPY DONUTS TO THE RESCUE.

24 hours, all day, all night - instant gratification for your donut-y cravings. Street parking at this hour is beyond easy, there's plenty of choices; it's an oasis of happiness lit on a street of otherwise darkness. Nighthawks anyone?

Now, the important part: the donuts range from AMAZING to I'm-not-sure-what's-in-this. I'm pretty sure personal preference (and maybe level of inebriation) play their parts in what makes these donuts explode in your mouth with fantastical energy versus a rather mediocre and forgettable encounter - but here's my experience:

THE APPLE FRITTERS ROCK.

THE DONUT HOLES SO LIGHT AND CRISPY.

And the rest (so far) are not quite paper because of the implication that anything can beat the apple fritters. I'm sure there may be other gems in the mix, but honestly, apple fritters and donut holes make it worth the visit at any time of day.

Just don't forget cash (read: cash only)!
author: Greg G.

description: yess after we found out that chloes cafe was shut thanksgiving morning we were so stoked to find this place and it was OPEN. gorgeous service, delicious food and a clean atmosphere. heaps of options to choose from and vegetarian friendly.
author: Button L.

description:
Well my first experience here was good donuts were awesome, just now no. Sold me an old donut with sour/rotten custard not fresh at all! Then when I called to complain the guy couldn't even understand what I was saying because he can barely speak English.
Won't return which is sad because I was about to become a regular! Oh well, don't need the extra fat anyways.
author: Kayla C.

description:
If this place wasn't so darn close to my apartment, I would never go here. I'm convinced this place is a drug front because the doughnuts here are SO cheap and there is no way they can possibly afford rent in this neighborhood selling $1 donuts...

8/10 times that I've been here, the doughnuts are not fresh. I hate how when I order a dozen doughnut holes, the lady hands me a pre-packed bag of holes instead of grabbing 12 from the huge tray of fresher-looking ones. 

I think the maple and chocolate bars are your best bet for non-dry doughnuts.
author: Vivian N.

description: Best donut shop I've found in San Fransisco (so far). Yes I've had bobs and dynamo, which are both good, but overrated in my opinion. Happy donuts is just a simple donut shop with really good donuts at donut prices (no $4 donuts here). I have not had any customer service issues like other yelpers, but then again I don't hang out at donut shops, I just get my goods and go!
author: Dylan B.

description: This review is for the freshly baked croissants donuts are ok too!
author: Josie C.

description: Went here at 2:00 in the morning and purchase a apple fritter and ate it two hours later after purchase and it was hard, taste like three days old... Will never go there again. I think I will try bobs donut on Polk st next!!
author: D D.

description: Great spot to quickly satisfy a sweet craving. Cheap, quick, and open 24 hours. Donuts are fresh and relatively light. Got a convenient selection of other foods and drinks.
author: Ken C.

description: Convenient location to walk to, and open 24 hours. Sugary goodness for cheap. What more do you want?
author: Ariana C.

description:
There are two things here I crave.  Frequently.

First is, seriously, the best apple fritter in the entire city.  Yes, better than Bob's, and certainly more consistent in quality.  Such an incredible blob of crunchy, cinnamony fried dough happiness, covered in sugary goodness.  UGH.  So good.

The other - and this is something rarely honored - is the breakfast bagel sandwich.  They fry the eggs thin in a pan, not a microwave.  The toasted asiago bagel with egg and cheese is so tasty...

Sometimes you just have to ignore the health department score.  It's probably just paperwork problems, right?

(Right?)

[Parking note:  In addition to the meters on 24th, there is permit parking on the Church Street side.  2 hours free, even if you don't have a permit.  And there's one 10-minute space.  Or just take the J, which stops directly outside.]
author: Mike B.

description:
All my daughter wanted was a brownie so we stopped here to get one and boy was it gross. Seriously, this was the worst tasting brownie that I have ever had. It was dry and tasteless.
I know what you are all thinking - Umm Hello, it's called Happy Donuts so you should've had a Happy Donut but we didn't want a donut OKAY!!!!
Anyhow, I was so turned off by the brownie that I didn't care to try their donuts!!!
Shame on you HAPPY DONUTS for making SAD BROWNIES!!!
author: Ursula U.

description:
Coffee: thin but drinkable. "Creamer" not half & half.

Glazed donut: heavy (as in not fluffy or airy), greasy, over-glazed. Before eating a few bites of this donut my scale for donut disappointment didn't go so high.
author: Joshua P.

description: It's open 24/7 and that's rare. I had a couple of their donut holes, which were decent. For a nice walk and OK coffee at night, I'm just glad it still exists.
author: Kristina B.

description:
Need: Hearty, simple, good warm yummy breakfast in Noe - without the fuss of a sitdown meal. 

Action: In a no fuss mood, skipped the neighborhood scene of the popular cafes, and their overpriced bfast treats.  Tried the straightforward donut shop, to order something other than my usual glazed donut, a croissant breakfast sandwich.

Result: Met my need and exceeded expectations. Croissant was warm flaky, cut perfectly center, scrambled egg folded nicely, bacon thin strips, (no fancy cuts)  and pressed together neatly, warm n yummy. Service fast n friendly, no crowded customer queue.  Ate half sandwich, took the rest in nice sturdy to go box. Mid morning it was still good in every bite. Satisfying. And $6 bucks. Win. 

Note: No restroom for customers. Menu options  (beyond donuts) hard to scan. Tables a lil dirty
author: Jayne S.

description:
LOVE IT ! 
great spot
 donuts that make me go nuts! 
wooohooo!!
author: Daniel D.

description:
):[ ANGRY DONUTS
 
I'm giving them 2 stars because I'd come back and try them again, but I came here REALLY EXCITED about late night donuts. There may or may not have been some alcohol involved. I walked a ways with complaining friends, promising I had read good reviews, and then I came in and this place just... had no donuts. 

NOOOOOOO
This is 11:30 on a Friday night, so you'd think this would be getting into prime late night drunken donut time for them. I stood there, miffed and awkward, as they just had a couple of croissants laying in the case. The guy at the counter didn't react to me saying, "so... are there no donuts? what?" with any sort of response about why they were out, when they would have more... nothing. 

GRUMPS. So I'll probably come back if I'm in the area again, and maybe with a different group of friends. But my trust has been betrayed, Happy Donuts.
author: Meryl S.

description: Cashier was completely rude. I simply asked what was included in a sandwich and spoke condescendingly with his response. I used to live in the neighborhood but it's definitely one of things I don't miss. Don't waste your time or money in this establishment
author: Sam V.

description: Yum. Came in a little buzzed after my birthday dinner because I never have doughnuts. Worth it! Got a chocolate donut and it was delicious and warm. They had lots to choose from :)
author: Alexandra W.

description: Great for late-night or early mornings. Wish it was slightly less expensive.
author: Brad W.

description: I love how fast the young girl working behind the counter is in the am. I get donut holes a 14 for $2. Their soda is really cold too! YAY!
author: Sweets N.

description:
Despite what the little blue star in my review suggests (above), I've checked in here FAR more than I care to admit. But I don't wanna look like a total donut whore. So I figured, 2 check ins makes me seem like a sensible person. My experience last night went like this...

Me: "I'll take 2 glazed cruellers."

Lady behind the counter: "That's 35 cent extra." 

Me: "Yeah okay."  

Lady: "I put back?"  

Me: "No, no. I want it."  

Lady: "So you want?"  

Me: "YESSSS" (gaawwd! *facepalm*) 

How many people actually reject a donut selection over 35 cents? Dude, I'm at a donut shop at 9pm on a Tuesday. Obviously I have very little self restraint, so please just put my donuts in the pink box. Having to repeat myself only adds to my embarassment.

I still love you, though, Happy Donut. You make me feel as your name suggests. And your donuts are always fresh. Even at 9pm on a Tuesday.
author: Mariela D.

description: BEST DONUTS EVER!!!!!!!!!!$ I ate eighteen donut holes by myself. Love. would recommend strongly. amazing love
author: Amanda H.

description:
My boyfriend surprised me with Happy Donuts at 5:30 yesterday morning. He was up, we live just down the street, and apparently he had a craving. The donuts were hot and FRESH. He apparently went to the guy frying them and asked for them almost directly out of the fryer. The Chinese guy frying them said people rarely do this, but kept remarking that he was "so smart" for getting them fresh. 

Now, maybe this is what went wrong. I'm not sure, but I did not like these donuts whatsoever because of their insanely high oil content. They were 50% oil 50% donut. We tried a sugar-raised, a cinnamon roll, and a chocolate frosted bar. The cinnamon roll was the worst offender and the chocolate frosted bar was bearable, with the sugar-raised somewhere in between. I'm not that sensitive to foods, but I felt not so great for the next few hours after eating these donuts. 

This isn't my first experience at Happy Donuts. I've come here late at night before and the donuts weren't remarkable then either. But this time was just bad. I've gone to other donut stores (Colonial in Oakland or Stan's in Santa Clara) where I've gotten donuts hot out of the fryer and they were a pure delight, not an oily mess.
author: Victoria J.

description: This charmless hole on the corner of 24th and Church survives by virtue of being the only place in Noe Valley where you can get something to eat past 11 on week nights.  The guy who works the night shift is a rude, inflexible little man.  Tonight I asked for an egg and cheese sandwich on whole wheat, and he refused because it wasn't on the menu.  He had whole wheat, but only for other sandwiches.  If you want an egg and cheese, you have to order it on a croissant.  Wrong job, little fella.  Misanthropes should not be allowed to serve people food.
author: Isaac C.

description:
If you want super satisfying and delicious donuts come here!  I've never been disappointed. My go-tos rotate btwn cinnamon glazed twist, holes, and apple fritters. Also good are their jam & cheese Danish, but they make limited quantities so they go quickly. My husband swears by their glazed donuts. Additionally satisfying is their sausage, egg, and cheese croissantwich.

AFA customer service, I've never had a problem with any if them. In fact, I've had some great conversations with them - and served with a smile. I never expected it or felt entitled to it so maybe that's a contributing factor. 

Hopefully their new estimated re-opening date of Feb 15 is accurate bc we are craving their donuts something fierce over here!
author: Arlie A.

description: I don't often write reviews, but when I do, I respect the amazing donut. Sugar raised was soft and fluffy and not greasy.  Eating a donut is a special thing, and when you have a bad donut, it's like trading a little piece of your life force for trash. Very sad. But today, I traded a little piece of my life force for a thing of beauty. Thank you happy donut. The donut purveyors were very nice too.
author: Michael J.

description: You have died and gone to doughnut heaven. Their basic glazed doughnuts are great. If you are lucky enough to see a cart off to the side with fresh doughnuts not yet in the display case, ask for one of whatever is on the cart. It's open 24 hours, and is frequented by police which makes the neighborhood feel safer to me. They only accept cash, but they have an ATM and there is a bank across the street. They have sandwiches for lunch/dinner. I'm going to try one today on one of their croissants. You have to try it.
author: David H.

description: We go here every day on the weekends. Everything is cheap and really good. Bagels, smoothies, and donuts, yum!
author: Lee D.

description:
"Happy Donuts" is a misnomer.  My daughter and I had been looking forward to trying this place all week and were excited to finally be there. But the young woman behind the counter was so rude and impatient with us for not knowing our donuts ("THIS is a buttermilk donut and THIS is an old-fashioned") and for asking her to repeat herself. Hey, there are a lot of different types of donuts in those cases; she's supposed to be the expert and help us out, right? Or at least be civil. But instead we got the exasperated sigh and the cocked head -- everything but the eyeroll (which we probably got as we walked out the door). The donuts were good, but the unfriendly treatment spoiled the outing, especially for my daughter.
FWIW, we were there Oct. 11, about 12:15 p.m., and the place was dead as a doornail. Maybe because of the shabby treatment they give their customers?
author: Felicia S.

description: I love this place! They are exactly what you expect them to be as far as donuts and price go but with the added perks of 24hours, great under 4 dollar sandwiches that come with chips and amazing service. This place is a throwback to an era gone by. Best early morning, late night spot!
author: michelle d.

description:
It seems this twenty-four hour place has been strategically placed in the area, because it seems to get a great deal of business. I came across this place many times during my visit to SF and was curious to try one of their donuts out. I tried the regular round donut, because after all, if you can't get that right-what can you get right in a donut shop? It was good, with not too much glaze. These folks had tossed out some new regular donuts, instead of waiting to sell out the nearly day-old donuts like some place may do.

I found the décor to be very much what I expected-not too neat or clean, but good enough for a quick stop over whether you're going to work or just want to grab one in the middle of the night. I also felt like the donut was overpriced, as I'm used to paying about 50-70 cents a donut in the suburbs. 

I can't say I'll come back, because the taste of the donut wasn't amazing. It was just a plain ol' fresh donut. I still believe Krispy Kreme sets a high bar for many donut shops. However, that is not to say the other donuts here, such as the apple fritter, may be amazing.
author: Mohib Q.

description:
For the first sweet thing I've eaten in two weeks, I could have chosen better. I got a chocolate-topped French cruller and a raspberry-filled. Now, French crullers are practically the most perfect donut out there, so to mess this up... I don't know. The thing is, the rows of donuts looked completely gorgeous and perfect - the raised donuts had a nice, high rise. Maybe my taste buds were just off for one night?

I would have been willing to give it the benefit of the doubt more if the guy behind the counter hadn't been kind of rude. Okay, we were kind of giggly and I'm sure he has to deal with more than his share of drunk idiots being open that late. But I don't really get it when people feel like they have to stand behind the counter and glare at you until you order. I know, I know, the other side of the coin is people who feel like as soon as they're ready to order the staff needs to be there to serve them. But that's not me. I don't like feeling pressured.

Good parts - open late and good prices. Might come back if I have a donut craving and don't want to go all the way to North Beach.
author: Amanda P.

description:
Wait, what? Happy Donuts has sandwiches? And a fully loaded turkey sandwich with a side of chips is only 4 bucks? HELL yeah. Not like I need another excuse to go to Happy Donuts, but I think I just found one. 

Also, I have to recognize the amazing staff here. Friendly, fun, and efficient!
author: Johnny W.

description: I have fat kid problems and this place sucked me in. Great donuts, just shut up and go there!
author: Matt R.

description:
Like Dunkin' Donuts but on the west coast.  The coffee works.  The guy who's here nights is really friendly.  Totally okay place.

I only ever come here around 3-4 am when the "24 hour" bodega next door is inexplicably closed, and there's usually either police or cab drivers hanging around outside.  I figure these people know their donuts and coffee.
author: Brian L.

description:
For a late night / early morning snack at work, this place works for me. I usually go for the croissant breakfast sandwiches, but have been known to indulge in the occasional jelly donut (or two). If I'm feeling especially needy, I'll order a sack of donut holes (or "happy pills" as I like to call them) to go.

The breakfast sandwiches are served on a buttery, flaky croissant with egg, cheese, and your choice of meat. The last few sandwiches I got here were a little burnt. I prefer the sandwiches from the Happy Donut shop at the end of the T Line near Sunnydale and Bayshore, but unfortunately, they're not open 24 hours.
author: Rory O.

description:
The donuts are ok but the people that run this place are A**holes.

I've had two bad experiences with this place.

First time I went there around 2am and asked for a jelly donut. On my way out I bit into the donut and there was something wrong. There was no sugar in it so it tasted like a piroshki with jelly.

I went back in and asked for a replacement donut. The guy running the place refused suggesting that I was trying to scam them (this seemed like a lot of work just for one  free bite of donut). Then he insisted that it was impossible that there was a problem with the donut. Since I had only taken one bite I suggested he try the donut. He refused, saying that there was no need since nothing could be wrong with the donut. I insisted, saying we could easily resolve this impasse if he would just taste the donut himself. Again he refused saying that I was trying to scam them. 

This went on for a little while but finally the tide turned. First, I was really annoyed so I decided just to throw out the donut and leave. However, the only garbage can I could see was behind the counter. I thought that if I threw it hard enough it would go straight in. This turned out to be wishful thinking and instead the donut hit the white wall about 5 feet above the garbage can. If nothing else, this confirmed that the donut was, indeed, full of jelly.

Around the same time, a number of customers started chanting: "give the man his jelly donut, give the man his jelly donut." Even then the donut guy refused to give me a replacement donut. Finally, a particularly large man who had clearly spent his evening in a bar got to his feet, pointed at the donut guy and shouted "GIVE HIM HIS JELLY DONUT!!"

This finally worked but it turned out that there were no more jelly donuts. The whole store started booing so, to defuse the situation, I accepted another, inferior type of donut. The store went quiet as everyone waited to see if this one was OK. I took a bite and confirmed that it was indeed a real donut and everyone applauded and I left.

The second experience was not as dramatic but still pissed me off. I went with my 6-year old son and we each got a donut. I paid but she didn't give me my change. Since it was only 15 cents it wasn't a big deal. However my son was very thirsty so I told him to ask for a glass of water. The woman running the store refused. I got up to ask as well and she said that there were no cups. When I pointed at the big stack of paper cups, she said that they could only be used for coffee. I thought it was rude not to give us water so I decided to ask for my 15 cent change. I told her I wanted it and went to the register. However, she made no move to give me the money. I waited and waited for her to come. After about 5-10 minutes I managed to get the attention of the other person working there (her son?). He explained, very rudely, that I had misunderstood the price. Fair enough but why did I have to wait for 5-10 minutes and then get insulted just to be told that?

Anyway, please do not go to this place. If you happen to live east of there I strongly recommend the donut shop on 24th about 2 blocks past Mission St. called the "Jelly Donut". The donuts are great and the people that work there are very nice.
author: John S.

description:
"I just did cardio for 45 minutes, I DESERVE THIS APPLE FRITTER." 

Like some cruel joke from the universe, Happy Donuts is located on the way to my gym.  Walking to the gym and walking back, I am lured by the smell of donuts that encapsulate the corner of 24th and Church.  The only way to resist is to purposely walk out of my apartment without any money because even a measly dollar can get you SOMETHING sweet here, which is awesome if you're cheap and/or unemployed but horrible if you need to lose several pounds.  The lure of doughnuts after working out is agonizing as my brain frantically rationalizes that one little doughnut hole can't hurt.  But who can eat just one doughnut hole?  Let's get real -- I can eat a dozen doughnut holes before I reach the end of the effing block.

Their food and coffee aren't the greatest, but definitely satisfying and worth what you pay for.  Living in Noe Valley for the past 13 years or so, I've come to rely on it more than once as a place to get a bite late at night after the bars close.  When the boyfriend can't be bothered to make breakfast himself or wait for me to wake up, he'll run down here to get us coffee and breakfast sandwiches that are way cheaper than the other options nearby such as La Boulange.  Tables are plentiful and service is fine.  The big windows that face the street give the place a very open feel which encourages folks to stay and linger.
author: Courtney Y.

description: ok went to happy donuts the last couple of times the French donut wasn't as fresh as it use to be and the last time my husband had a glaze twist he said it was over cooked and not very fresh . I think they use to sell only the fresh donuts. now I think they may be selling the older ones too !
author: Nellie J.

description: The glazed donut here has improved significantly since my last review: Airy, soft, and with the perfect glaze "crust." I actually prefer their glazed donut over the one at Bob's Donuts.
author: ML P.

description:
My friends and I happened to stumbled in here one day for no good reason. The croissant sandwiches were alright, but greasy as hell. I almost never use napkins, but I had to use at least 5 here!

+ open 24 hours
author: Jennifer W.

description: This rating is for the doughnuts.  For a classic doughnut, this is the place.  They're fresher and lighter than any place I've been around here.
author: Brett W.

description:
Coming home on a rainy Friday & the yeasty, sugary smells of delicious donuts come out of Happy Donuts & I just can't resist 

Walk into see shelf upon shelf of tempting choices - the super-nice lady held up each item I chose to ensure I was getting exactly what my heart desired

Went for the Sugar-Coated Yeast (light, chewy) & an Old-Fashioned-Chocolate Iced (cakey, moist) 

Made a rainy Friday a happy day indeed - thanks Happy Donuts!
author: Adrienne G.

description:
When I'm walking through Noe Valley/Waiting for the J train or going home in a cab through the Mission, this is a hard place to pass up! 

For one, I usually avoid coffee at all costs (I'm extremely sensitive to caffeine) but I do make an exception for Happy Donut's coffee selection. They've got so many flavors that you wanna try 'em all. It smells delicous. It also makes it hard to pass up since they've got huge glass windows so you see all the donuts and smell the sweet scent deserts and coffee when you walk by.
author: Erin M.

description: This is a doughnut shop that is open 24/7. They are cash only, but there is an ATM conveniently located right inside their store, so no problems there. The doughnuts are reliably good and fresh, and very, very cheap. Definitely a great spot in Noe Valley and I am so, so happy it is always open.
author: Jazzy O.

description: I've had better, I've had worse. The best part about this place is that the never close.
author: Geordie E.

description: This place had no donuts at 11pm on a Friday night. WTF?!! For a 24 hour place on a Friday night, that's a freakin disgrace!
author: Joe B.

description:
There are 2 reasons why I come here: (in no particular order)
1. My roomie enjoys a good hotdog after binge drinking on 24th street
2. Sunan, the cashier, might be the funniest immigrant I have ever met. 

Half the time I cannot understand him though his accent, half the time he cannot understand me through my slurring. It is a beautiful relationship, punctuated by exchanges of cultural knowledge and donut holes.
In the past, he has let a racist comment or two slip, but I have decided that I will not let that detract from my love of  his 24 hour fried goods.
author: Juliette F.

description: This place is incredible. Open 24/7. The apple fritter is out of this world....thank god there is a 24 hour fit-lite just across the street.  Coffee is freshly brewed.  Great place to sit and just chill. Awesome.
author: Steve P.

description:
The official last establishment of attempting to make sense and place a resolution in regards to the demise of our relationship, but IT's inefficient verbiage made me burst into tears again (much to the chagrin and anger of my friends in Boston)

"What the f***?? That motherf*****.  He's no man. That douche!"

I adore my Bahstonian friends, can you see that?  

Happy Donuts was silently jeering at our situation, but perhaps when a relationship ends and there are truly no strings to tuck back into places invoking normalcy, the appearance of sweet puffy pastries and hot coffee steaming on the counters was all silenced persons such as ourselves could look to for encouragement.

I had a large coffee.  Lots of cream.  Lots of sugar.  I made note of the 75 cents for a refill.

He had a small coffee and a large cinnamon roll. Cash only.  Good thing, had only $5 on him.

He offered a piece of the brown glazed bready snail to me. 

Zoom went a little arrow through my head.  I viewed the piece of donut hanging from his fingers, fishbowl view.  You see, I have been working out like crazy, most likely to transition the stresses of my dead car and the dead relationship off my shoulders and mind.  The good thing, is that doing cardio at a vicious pace saves me from insanity.  In addition, I'm losing weight and packing my butt up, a rare feat for this Japanese lady.

"No thanks," I refuse and continue to look out to the window.  IT's chatter becomes more of interference sound, the undramatic zzzzzz on a black and white screen.

It was late, probably around 10:30 pm.  The man behind the counter was busy running doing his chores, cleaning and prepping, probably wondering who-the-hell was the sobbing idiot sitting near the windows.  An older gentleman sitting behind Walter kept on throwing me sympathetic glances during my bouts of talking and babbling.  Men walking on the sidewalk sent me furtive glances; reassuring ones at the very least.

The world seems to have taken pity on me lately.  Am I wearing the scarlet "R" for yet another relationship dead on my chest?

Sipping good smooth coffee and watching people stream by like ghosts on Muni made me feel a little better.  Perhaps this moment was just a rift in the apparition of what our relationship had become: dead.  It was terrible knowing that he would no longer be a part of my life, however the situation was made slightly sweeter with the knowledge that the large and strong display of sugared bread twists, glazed bear claws and pink frosted donuts had my back.  And they weren't going anywhere and they don't smoke.

Now that's what I call a man.
author: Miika M.

description: A donut shop. It serves donuts and it's open 24 hours a day. The donuts are good and their sandwiches are pretty good too. That's it.
author: Robert B.

description: I used to go to the one in Palo Alto which was rarely Happy, unlike the namesake. However after a fulfilling meal of Spanish tapas/pintxos down the way, and short drop in at the market next door, it was awesome and cliche to see three happy cops go in and perpetuate the stereotype :)
author: Kim N.

description:
Have spent way too much time here, much more than I'd like to admit. The only Happy Donuts location in the City worth actually hanging out at for more than a minute. 

Love the people that work here. If you point at the donut you want without knowing its name they will often politely scold you by telling you what it is called. I always go chocolate on chocolate.
author: Ben M.

description:
After trying a number of different types of donuts at Happy Donuts I can say with conviction that they are top notch.

And they remain tasty through the next day, which is important!
author: Miriam W.

description: Best donuts in San Francisco. Open 24 hours, and their chicken salad sandwich is of the utmost quality among donut shop sandwiches.
author: Daniel C.

description: Order an apple fritter and a green tea. Then take the Muni J line to Deloris park. It'll be the best $5 you've ever spent in the city.
author: Jeff C.

description: This might be my favorite donut spot in the area.  I love the buttermilk donuts.  They are huge, fluffy and delicious.  I just ate one and am tempted to walk back and get another.
author: beverly l.

description:
I love love love donuts and i love love love our little HAPPY DONUTS in Noe. It's super conveniently located whether you're popping off to work or trying to catch the J. 
Super friendly donuteers, love the neighborhood vibe, definitely a spot for locals. 
My faves are, as usual, the Sugar Raised and Chocolate Raised, which are delish and quite a treat. However I have recently discovered the dozen Donut Holes for $1.95 !!! Whatasteal, great for sharing with friends, esp. if you don't want a whole donut you can just have a hole :)
The Croissants are also good but I would just recommend getting the fresh 'nuts or 'sants instead of the sammies. 
CASH ONLY!
author: Mary Ella D.

description: Happy Donuts makes the best Apple Fritters in town.  It is so light, fluffy, crunchy, moist and you can actually see chunks of apple in them.  And always really fresh.  I just love it.  HIghly recommend it!!!  I'd go here first over Bob's on Polk Street.
author: Joy L.

description:
Not quite ready to go home after DYL, we roam Noe Valley in search of this establishment. I wonder if it's the same place we went during a drunken b-day extravaganza of a Yelployee. 

Finally, drawn in by the smell of fresh donuts, we find the place. Turns out it is the place I went years ago. 

The first time I went, I was there for _________'s birthday (don't ask). We all had gone from Little Bao Bau and needed something other than ethanol to fuel our night. As there was a decent sized group of us, we hailed a limo/taxi. I'll never forget when someone in our party pulled out a couple of champagne glasses from her purse, apparently "souvenirs" from the limo. 

Ok, must focus. This last time, the place is quite as a grave, but I guess it's supposed to be at 4:00 in the morning. The smell of fresh donuts fills the air and these delectable deep fried goodies are neatly arranged in the glass display cases. I'm not that hungry so I don't get anything at first. Instead, I taste Theron's crasanwich which is ok but a little salty. After a long conversation about the night's shenanigans and a nameless/tactless Yelper, I need a taste of the "mystery cruller". One bite and I have discovered that it's a Hawaii Punch flavored cruller ($1.25). 

I like the place....like a fat kid loves cake, but I will definitely stick to the donuts and a hot chocolate. The sandwich was meh.
author: Angelo F.

description:
Best 24 hour donut shop in town. I live a few houses down, which is unfortunate because I need to pass them a lot and smell their freshly baked donuts and pastries. 

If only they only had donuts, but oh not, they need to have great apple fritters, cinnamon rolls, twists, etc. They have a great coffee selection too.

The people who work there are friendly, fast and efficient. The guy who works there at night is always polite and cheerful regardless of the hour, and the girl who occasionally works there during the day is smoking hot.

What more do you need in a donut shop?
author: Jordan C.

description:
My friend lives across the street from here.  Ok, if you are in a budget while in the city, this is the place to survive on.  They have cheap yummy sandwiches and succulent donuts for your to grieve about later.  Yesterday I inhaled a cinnamon donut and still don't know how I did that....was I conscious?    I want to try their freshly squeezed orange juice another day.

CASH ONLY!
author: Michelle M.

description: the fact that this place is open 24 hrs and located across the street from a bar makes it the best donut spot here. Croissant sandwich is good as well as the hot dogs. Word out on the street is that their egg salad is the SH*T.
author: John N.

description:
Sometimes you feel like having a donut. And if you live near Happy Donuts and have a couple bucks (cash only), you're in luck, because Happy Donuts is open 24/7, and their donuts are good. They don't have fancy gourmet donuts (as seems to be the craze), but they have all the classics: braided donuts, apple fritters, glazed, and cake donuts are all in abundant supply, and they're delicious. Some, though, are better than others; My first visit here, my fiance and I shared a cake donut and a glazed donut. The cake donut was pretty bland and was just too dense and crumbly. If you like dense, crumbly cake donuts, you might like it, but I much preferred the light, fluffy texture of the glazed donut. My second visit here, I was hoping to give Happy Donuts another chance to impress me, and impress me it did. I got an apple fritter and a braided donut, and both were pretty amazing. The apple fritter was huge, simultaneously crispy and fluffy, and had an almost candy-like glazed top (I found it to be a little too sweet alone, but a small piece of the fritter accompanied by coffee was just right). The twisted glazed donut, though, was my favorite, with a pillow-like fluffiness and the dough had complex flavor; I highly recommend it. 

I will definitely be going back here when I have a craving for some donuts!
author: Zameer A.

description: My french choco-donut was really quite good and fun to eat on the MUNI ride home. And cheap.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I never seem to get there late enough for fresh donuts, they seem to start making muffins at 9:00 p.m.

Still the donuts are good even if they're not still warm from the fat.

Open 24 Hours, and competitively priced.

The sort of clientele one would expect in Noe Valley -- bland and nonthreatening. Which -- let's be honest -- is an improvement over certain other 24-hour donut shops.
author: BigJohnS F.

description:
This place is smart for being open 24/7 - there's nothing else in Noe that supports the drunks coming home from the bars.

Otherwise - I'm not really a donut person, and everything else at this place is mediocre - I could make better sandwiches myself, and their smoothies are made from mix. 

But, it gets the job done when you have a 3AM craving. That's about it.
author: Kristen B.

description: Donut stop #3.    Raised donut holes were ok.  They were probably a lot better 12 hours ago when they were first fried.  Sour cream donut bar was a little too dense and wasn't glazed before the choc. frosting was put on so it dried out.   The fritters looked kinda burnt.  On a much better note, the apple turnover was Excellent!  The layers were flakey and buttery w/o being slippery and greasy. Lots of chunks of apple.  If u go... Try the apple turnover!
author: Tad H.

description:
I dropped in here one night on my way home from a class.

I walk up, order a custard donut and a large coffee. 

Asian guy behind the counter looked absolutely miserable, so I didn't really chit-chat, and asks me if I want custard in my custard donut. What??!!  What kind of asshole question is that? 

No big deal, I say yes, and sit down to enjoy it. 

Some bum walks in and asks to use the John, but counter-guy says no, and as the bum turned to leave, he threw a basket of chips all over the floor. Asian guy screams at him, the bum flips him the bird. Whatever. I ignore it.

5 minutes later this douche-bag of a woman walks in and orders a latte-something or other, sits down, and loudly chats on her cell phone the entire time.

Bitch, you aren't that important.

I wanted to strangle her by the time I was ready to leave, but the J Church was barreling down to the bus stop, so I didn't have time.
author: Matthew F.

description:
Great tasting, fresh donuts, low prices, what more do you want?

I haven't had the coffee or the breakfast sandwiches but the donuts - both the cake and the yeast style - are delicious.  The only way this place could be better is if they made a blueberry or cherry donut like I used to have when I was a kid in the Midwest.
author: Steve B.

description: The bear claw I had was ok but the sandwich and coffee were not very good at all. The only thing I liked was the price of the sandwich. I probably won't come back.
author: Kenneth C.

description: I am a regular at Happy Donuts and proud of it!  I stop in at least 2 or 3 times a week for my egg and cheese croissant or tuna sandwich.  You can't beat the prices at Happy Donuts.  Most sandwiches are under $5 and you can grab a donut for a buck.  I'm not one to eat sweets, but I have tried an old fashioned here and it was super fresh and delicious!
author: Crystal I.

description:
Donuts aside, they make a surprisingly good tuna salad sandwich here. I always have mine on a toasted bagel without onions (blech), and have yet to be disappointed. 

My schedule has changed recently (read, I was laid off), so I have been keeping weird hours. I love that they're open 24 hours a day and don't look at you weird when you come in at 3AM and order a tuna sammie.  The lack of crackheads is also appealing, 

Anyway, if you're in the neighborhood, give Happy Donuts a shot.
author: C P.

description:
Happy Donut in Noe Valley?  Really?  

I typically consider this donut chain pretty ghetto ... but the shop on 24th street in San Francisco deserves the genuinely positive reviews it gets.  It is clean, offers the standard fare of donuts and coffee at all hours, and even has decent sandwiches.  I really enjoyed my maple old-fashioned donut this morning and will try the apple fritter sometime later this week while I am house-sitting nearby.  My main justification for the return trip being at least I will be walking to the BART station to burn a few of the calories off ...
author: Anne K.

description: The guy that works at night lent me $20 of his personal money to help pay for a cab in the middle of the night when my card wasn't working and I had a family emergency. Says a lot. These guys are as great as their donuts. :)
author: Tim S.

description: Would you like fresh donuts with a decent cup of coffee, this is the place to go. Maybe you would like a sandwhich, those are good too. The people that work there are always pleasant and the shop is clean.
author: Dolores C.

description:
I work until 3 am just across the street. You've probably seen me in here a few times at random hours.

One word: coffee. This place saves my life. That is all.
author: Courtney S.

description: Yummmm....lovely baked and fried sweets, with.crunchy exterior appropiate for the recipe; great cake flavor and texture inside.  I grew up in this neighborhood, and the men at Shufat still remember me! (Wow!)!   Wonderful corner, two fabulous retail food businesses.  I will always come back.
author: janice s.

description:
I am at a loss...
5 or 4 stars.....?????
Hummmmm... I guess it depends on what time of day it is, when I go in.

I go in normally for an old fashion, sometimes it'll be glazed, sometimes plain. Both are quite fine, perfect for my dangerous living, throwing my cholesterol balance off teeter. A simple cup of joe. Straight up with good flavor, no frilly fru fru coffee with hidden calories. Sure, I know it's Noe Valley, there's StarBuckeroo, Pete's and Martha's but my moto is "Death to all but Happy Donuts on 24th!" 
I'll prefer my calories via carb express!
That's right, bring on the sugar and oil! Maybe I'll go for for a maple custard bar, naw, make it a bear claw.... maybe a jelly filled....

I give this palace 5 stars, for when  we walk in at 6:30 am. Got our choice of news papers, books or comics to chill out to. That is when I feel I own the place. You get your odd characters that saunter in bringing in some flair. But the ladies, who run the place, have their charm, smiles and friendly disposition, they got it going on. It is a simple donut, coffee, sandwich joint. It is clean, fresh, and familiar. Prices are right. Yes, even the top connoisseurs, the SFPD  go there. So you know it's good there.

4 stars, when it's over run by everyone else. If I need a sugar fix, I dash in to grab a lemon bar and a Dr. Pepper, and the ladies are still smiling!
author: e.s.s. A.

description:
After many months of coming here way later/earlier than I should, I now have a fairly complete schedule of when the fresh donuts are ready:

2am - muffins, cake donuts, buttermilk donuts and old fashioned donuts
3am - donut holes
4am - raised donuts

I just had some fresh donut holes the other night for the first time -- pure heavenly bliss. You guys all owe me big time for this information.
author: Aaron V.

description:
What a great way to get that sugar rush for the walk home and sugar crash for right when you hit your bed.  With a stomach full of liquor, this place will offer the one-two punch to knock you out till mid afternoon of the next day.

The glazed donuts and the cinnamon twists are my usual chosen path. Get 'em!
author: Pickles T.

description:
My love is as a fever, longing still
For that which longer nurseth the disease,
Feeding on that which doth preserve the ill,
The uncertain sickly appetite to please.
My Reason, the physician to my love,
Angry that his prescriptions are not kept,
Hath left me, and 1 desperate now approve
Desire is death, which physic did except.
Past cure I am, now reason is past care,
And frantic-mad with evermore unrest;
My thoughts and my discourse as madmen's are,
At random from the truth vainly express'd;
For I have sworn thee fair and thought thee bright,
Who art as black as hell, as dark as night. 

Shakespearean Sonnet CXLVII 

----------

Be my Valentine Happy Donut, you please me and make me feel warm all over.
author: Bill B.

description:
Happy Donuts. If they were trying to weave an evocative image of blissful donuts singing and prancing about just waiting for some dude like me to come around and dunk their sweet sweet asses in scalding hot coffee they really needn't bother. They had me at "donuts." Hell, there are times when just "do" is enough.

I used to work on 24th. St and at the end of every week, I would reward myself with deep fried dough covered in a sugary glaze. I got pretty intimate with the chocolate old fashioned (no not THAT intimate! Just some heavy petting and LOTS of tongue) and the cinnamon rolls but you really can't go wrong here. 

Also, if you're ever in need of police assistance there's a pretty good chance you can find a cop here. I've seen up to three squad cars parked outside. I thought the place had been robbed. C'mon guys, do you really need to perpetuate the stereotype? How about treating yourself to some nice brioche every once in a while?

Well, there's not a whole lot of donuts being eaten these days as part of my "New Me in 2007"(TM megan w.) plan so instead I'll just have to send you fucking slobs over to Happy Donuts so that I can enjoy their glazed deliciousness vicariously...just let me smell your breath afterwards.
author: Josua P.

description: Had a fresh, still-warm buttermilk donut from HD the other night...so amazing. Way better than any of these reimagined hipster donuts. You guys seriously need a twitter account so you can announce what's coming out fresh from the fryer.
author: Chris R.

description:
I got pulled into this donut shop at 6:30am on Saturday morning by the amazing smell of donuts baking. . . mmmmm.

I ordered a chocolate round donut - I like to eat donuts every now and then, alright.  This doesn't make me evil, or a republican, it doesn't make me a baby-hater, or a horrible meat-eating bitch.  This just means that I like to eat a donut every now and then.  So suck it.

I love this little donut shop for it's quick service, friendly staff, and good cheap coffee.
author: Kelly H.

description:
Few combinations in life are better than a sugary cake like donut and a hazelnut coffee. Even if it means that it keeps you up all night watching Weeds Season 2 (which was totally purchased legally! totally!) and then  the end of Veronica Mars Season 1 (very good twist ending on who killed lilly - totally didn't expect it!!).  I am a sucker for strong, sassy, beautiful female leads with black male sidekicks. It's just my thing.  

They also sell breakfast sandwiches here, which are  yummy & greasy. I recommend the croissant over the english muffin.  I do not recommend the unflavored coffee, which tastes awful.
author: Maria D.

description:
Happy?  How about ecstatic?!  The donuts here have always been incredibly fresh and tasty. Husband swears by their cinnamon rolls. Friendly service makes it that much sweeter!  

I'm always confused by the different Happy Donut locations around the city. Are they all the same? This is the only one I've been to and I'm hesitant to try the others. They couldn't possibly measure up, could they?
author: Abby W.

description:
Such delicious donuts. The best is to get them when they're fresh. I had a crueler right after it came out of the oven & it was so amazingly fantastic. 

Now I just can't bring myself to eat them when they are more than an hour old. Its basically a donut at 2 in the morning or none at all. 

Once you've had the best why settle for the rest?
author: Rebekah K.

description: They have really yummy fresh donuts, and just when I thought they couldn't get any better, I learn they're open 24 hours AND serve breakfast sandwiches all day and all night. You can get a huge ham, egg and cheese croissant sandwich for $4 bucks. I love this place, so awesome!
author: Patricia P.

description:
The beauty that is cheap 24 hour donuts and pastries, with fresh ones available as soon as the bars close, cannot be overstated. Their inventory is good at any time of day - tasty, never stale, adequately cooled but not cold - but the warmth and extra softness of fresh donuts and muffins at 2am makes Happy Donuts a happy place for me.
